sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SIMLA, the administrative headquarters of the above district, and the summer capital of India, stands at an elevation of 7084 feet above sea level. Since the administration of Sir John Lawrence (1864) it has been the resort, during the hot weather, of the successive governors-general of India, with their secretaries and headquarters
establishments. In 1881 it had a population of 13,258.
